result.execSummary:
The defendant David M Berrier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $114.50 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M Berrier

records.addlTxt: Voucher to DOA for Polk Co Treas to pay $273.00 Ct App'ted Atty fees - no reimbursement required.

CT accepts plea, finds Def G & enters JOC.  Atty Anderson - Def to pay the restitution amt today.  SENTENCE:  $114.50 fine/costs.  $200.00 DNA surchg.  60 dtp.  PCR.  Rest surch not being added as it will be paid today.  11:42 am adj.
Atty Bruce P Anderson appointed, NO reimbursement required.

records.addlTxt: No contact with Cheryl Schnell.   Not to commit any new crimes.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.

Defendant David M Berrier in court with attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  RL/KJB- Clerk. 3:11pm. Def-NG plea. WST. Bond cont. 3:14 pm adj.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.
